item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Rudy Wiebe
item.description: "Those Mennonite villages in Russia are my heritage, but not my world. The world I feel and sense in my bones is the bush of northern Saskatchewan, of prairie Canada." -- Rudy Wiebe

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Nicholas Dickner
item.description: "A thousand years earlier, an old nomad lay down in this circle of stone to finally put an end to his migrations. His soul and his carbon-14 were carried off by the wind, but his bones have not moved since then." -- Nicholas Dickner
